alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 8:51PM EDT until May 10 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON...BERKELEY AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 851 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Magnolia Gardens to Daniel Island, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Downtown Charleston, West Ashley, Daniel Island, Fort Sumter, Johns Island, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Hollywood, Isle Of Palms, Folly Beach, Ravenel, and Sullivan`s Island. This warning includes the following interstates: I-26 between mile markers 211 and 221. I-526 between mile markers 11 and 31. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
